hypothesis_content.title: BTC Breakout Momentum Fades in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when Bitcoin (BTC) experiences a sharp 1-hour breakout (>3% gain) on elevated volume (>150% of 20-period average), the momentum will fade within the next 4 hours, presenting a short-term mean reversion opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack sustained directional conviction. Sharp, high-volume breakouts often exhaust buying pressure quickly, leading to profit-taking and failed follow-through, especially when starting from overbought conditions.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour volume > 150% of its 20-period moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price retraces 50% of the initial 1-hour breakout candle's range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes a new 4-hour high above the breakout candle's high
exit_conditions.time_exit: 4 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If, in a Neutral regime, >60% of such BTC breakouts continue to rally for more than 4 hours without a 50% retracement.
